events.name: connectionReceived
events.summary: Fired when the server socket receives an incoming connection.

properties.name: socket
properties.summary: The socket object bind to the connection.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: close
methods.description: This method, when called, closes the server socket. One cannot start accepting connections again after calling this method. On error, this method will throw an exception.

methods.name: isAccepting
methods.summary: Determines whether the server socket is currently accepting connections.

returns.summary: True if the server socket is accepting connections, false otherwise.

methods.name: startAccept
methods.summary: Inform the server socket to start accepting incoming connections.
methods.description: This method, when called, starts listening for the incoming Bluetooth connections and block until a connection is established. Listen for the connectionReceived event to be notified when a connection is received or the error event when an error occured during accepting connection.

parameters.name: keepListening
parameters.summary: Defines whether the server socket should keep listening after an incoming connection was received. If this parameter is false, it will stop accepting connections after a single connection is recieved.

methods.name: stopAccept
methods.summary: Inform the server socket to stop accepting incoming connections.
methods.description: This method, when called stop accepting incoming connections. One can again start accepting connections via startAccept method after calling this method. On error, this method will throw an exception.
